intro: Smythea poomae, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Smythea poomae thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
